programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to keep his winning streak going, while Darrell and Rene play mind games with each other. Jarrod and Brandi visit a crime scene and travel back in time.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find a vintage military motorcycle and replica cannon in Arlington, Virginia.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a rare punt gun after winning two units at an auction in Pasadena.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor's bidding war with Ricky and Bubba continues at Fort Worth, where he seeks an ally. Meanwhile, other buyers find they might be better off working alone.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Texarkana in search of new territory. Slick Vic uncovers some action figures, and Ricky and Bubba find an unforgettable antique.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz unearth a Schwinn motorbike and some BB guns, before taking a walk on the wild side to reach a valuable fireplace.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.sub-title: The Black Wolf and the White Wolf
programme.desc: On the Pope's orders, Landry and Tancrede travel to invesigate the Holy Grail's whereabouts. Meanwhile, the plotting behind the royal wedding becomes deadly. Part-fictionalised drama , starring Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.sub-title: He Who Discovers His Own Self, Discovers God
programme.desc: Gawain Gawain conducts a murder investigation, trying to work out who killed the Saracen. After interviewing everyone, he blames an initiate caught having in midnight snack on the night of the murder. A pagan helps Landry search his past, while Princess Isabella is betrayed. Tom Cullen stars.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine memoirs of the Duke and Duchess of Windsor signed by the couple themselves, and a collection of tin army trucks from the 1950s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine rare hand-made Pinocchio dolls, a harmonica belonging to Aerosmith lead singer Steven Tyler, and a valuable baseball card from 1909.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate why sightings of Bigfoot are so often accompanied by reports of UFOs. Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether the Sasquatch could be an alien living in society's midst.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Experts contemplate whether an advanced civilisation of giants built Malta's mysterious megaliths, with the native people having only limited involvement. Presented by Giorgio Tsoukalos.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Two blade smiths pay homage to Hollywood, re-create one of the most famous swords in cinematic history.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Cindy and Rick look forward to returning to the auction in Western where they cleaned up last time, while Paul urges Bogart to act on his feelings.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Don and the guys are in an upscale area of Toronto for another auction, while Roy is on the lookout for high-end items, but needs to be able to scupper Rick and Cindy's plans.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny Grumbles competes against her rivals to buy the locker of her dreams, while one of her fellow bidders demonstrates a darker side.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A stranger on a motorbike drives up the prices at an auction in DeSoto, where there are only four lockers up for grabs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers make some risky bids when they attend an auction at Fort Worth.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny brings her mother to an auction, and Moe annoys Mary by bidding for a risky locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary and Moe compete with a huge crowd of bidders, and the locker they are after is guaranteed to make Moe's wife angry.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Take a Deep Breath, It's Lesa
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Conroe, where they come face to face with an old adversary.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor's bidding war with Ricky and Bubba continues at Fort Worth, where he seeks an ally. Meanwhile, other buyers find they might be better off working alone.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Texarkana in search of new territory. Slick Vic uncovers some action figures, and Ricky and Bubba find an unforgettable antique.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys uncover a Miami Dolphins souvenir from the team's very beginnings, and meet a customer who claims to have unseen footage of President Franklin D Roosevelt.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are tempted by a musket owned by famous inventor Eli Whitney and a golf ball that once belonged to president Lyndon B Johnson.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine rare hand-made Pinocchio dolls, a harmonica belonging to Aerosmith lead singer Steven Tyler, and a valuable baseball card from 1909.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine memoirs of the Duke and Duchess of Windsor signed by the couple themselves, and a collection of tin army trucks from the 1950s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a ring that once belonged to notorious 1930s gangster Lucky Luciano and a letter signed by a famous American football coach.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys buy a valuable 1961 guitar, and discover a copy of National Geographic covering the first moon landing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over the prices of an antique pistol, a mining certificate issued to Mark Twain and a valuable Spider-Man comic.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a Second World War pilot's jacket and a piece of the Apollo 11 spacecraft, and try to determine if J Edgar Hoover's signature in a book is genuine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a baseball bat signed by three famous players, a motor racing suit once worn by Paul Newman, and a rare poster of Jimi Hendrix.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value an air mail letter delivered by aviation pioneer Charles Lindbergh on the Spirit of St Louis, as well as a collection of mini bikes and a baseball bat from the 1900s.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Ian and Butzy drop in on Killeneure Castle, before rock 'n' rolling to Limerick City for pop memorabilia from U2 and Thin Lizzy, along with the bar that film star Oliver Reed drank at.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An Oregon man shoots some incredible Bigfoot footage, UFOs gather over Texas and an active poltergeist appears in Wales.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and his sons travel to Phoenix, Arizona, and meet with famed alien abductee Travis Walton and local fulgurite specialist Dr B.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and his sons hitch a ride on a research vessel to investigate rumours of a secret underwater base off the coast of Malibu.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: Kevin and his team battle serious injury and dangerous waters in their determination to find a fortune in stolen gold at the bottom of Lake Michigan.

programme.title: Britain's War of Thrones: The Hundred Years War, with Dan Jones
programme.desc: Dan Jones, writer, historian and consultant on Knightfall, continues his exploration of the Hundred Years War..

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Lucy remembers the time she was in an episode of Doctors acting alongside Fleabag star Phoebe Waller Bridge. Jon's never seen the footage. Until now.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets more tasks for comedians including Frank Skinner. He takes a boulder onto a train for a pleasant excursion. Then he, Roisin Conaty, Tim Key, Romesh Ranganathan and Josh Widdicombe try to make a Swedish man blush.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Janey Godley and barrister Robert Rinder joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer abandons his crewmates on a disintegrating spaceship, and ends up marooned on a barren planet for 600 years. After decades of boredom, he uses the escape pod's cloning equipment to populate his new home with duplicates of himself. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Chef Jordan Andino is on the hunt to find restaurants that reign supreme in the late-night food scene, meeting other chefs to taste their most popular dishes.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson test-drives two estate cars - the BMW M5 and Mercedes E63. Richard Hammond tries out motor-home racing, while James May pits an Alfa Romeo 159 against a man who crosses the Humber estuary without using its famous bridge. The Stig puts Honda's Civic Type R through its paces and former England rugby union forward Lawrence Dallaglio is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank come across the best comic book, superhero and sci-fi memorabilia in the history of the show, including a rare Spider-Man comic book and the original Batmobile.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: A selection of the most memorable bargains picked up by the team during the series.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Carol Vorderman, Larry Lamb, Jo Brand and Russell Howard join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guests Fern Britton, Stephen Mangan, Ken Livingstone and Reginald D Hunter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jimmy Carr and Marcus Brigstocke, TV presenter Terry Christian and singer Jamelia join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an 'Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Carol Vorderman, Larry Lamb, Jo Brand and Russell Howard join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guests Fern Britton, Stephen Mangan, Ken Livingstone and Reginald D Hunter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jimmy Carr and Marcus Brigstocke, TV presenter Terry Christian and singer Jamelia join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister and Rimmer finally arrive back on Earth, only to discover they have slipped through a time hole into a period where everything occurs backwards. Sci-fi space comedy, starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The ship is on a collision course with five black holes and Holly recommends that the crew members abandon Red Dwarf and regroup after the danger is over. Cat and Kryten take off in Blue Midget, while Lister and Rimmer make their escape in Starbug, but are marooned when it is hit by a meteor and crash lands on an icy planet. Starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A grotesque, salivating genetic mutant goes on the rampage aboard the ship, spreading terror and stealing the crew's emotions, leaving Lister without fear and Rimmer with no anger. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Frances Barber.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on events in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Tom Allen, Ed Byrne, Kerry Godliman and Tez Ilyas. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other. First shown in July 2018.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Suzi Ruffell. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Sally Phillips, Desiree Burch and Jessica Knappett join Dave to try to unscramble the seemingly scrambled.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dover to the Isle of Wight. Geographer Nicholas Crane hangs off the cliffs near Beachy Head, East Sussex, to discover how the chalk coastline was formed and historian Neil Oliver investigates why the Victorian Channel Tunnel was started more than 120 years ago but never finished. Meanwhile, anthropologist Alice Roberts visits the Isle of Wight, where she meets the men who helped launch Britain's first satellite.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The murder in 1943 of businessman Sir Harry Oakes in the Bahamas, where the Duke of Windsor was governor at the time, and implicated in influencing the outcome of his murder trial.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Titanic: Stories from the Deep
programme.desc: Thanks to the use of cutting-edge technology, a unique collection of artefacts salvaged from the underwater resting site of the famous wreck suggest new stories of love, deception, fate and heroics. This first episode touches on Fifth Officer Harold Lowe. After Titanic sank, his lifeboat was one of the few to go back and pick up survivors. One of the people he saved, Renee Harris, gifted him a set of gold-plated nautical equipment as a symbol of her gratitude. Plus, a well-preserved alligator bag recovered from the wreck site containing fascinating clues about the life of its owner.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Two long-dead sexually conjoined bodies fall through the ceiling of a former bank after being disturbed by builders, and a gold ingot found at the scene suggests a connection with another cold case. When Eve links one of the corpses to the Opus Dei organisation, Boyd is warned off pursuing that particular line of investigation.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Dan Casper has a humiliating run-in with three yobs and later tries to save face by telling Amber they threatened him with a knife. On a less harrowing note, he also enjoys a romantic encounter with new Drugs Referral Officer Rochelle Barratt. Meanwhile, Honey finally confronts Scott, who breaks down and admits to killing his previous wife Karen. Understandably shocked by his confession, she implores him to turn himself in - but when the police arrive at their house, neither husband nor wife is anywhere to be seen.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Kevin is faced with the consequences of his affair with Sally after a party on the houseboat. Meanwhile, Nick's fears for Ariadne escalate, but he is temporarily distracted when he has to rescue a boy from a well.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: A party of pilgrims is imprisoned within Shrewsbury Abbey on suspicion of murdering an old man whose body is discovered in a sack. Sleuthing monk Cadfael is soon on the scent of the killer, boiling the corpse down to its bones to ascertain the cause of death - and finding a tiny cross that could provide a vital clue. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Michael Culver, Julian Firth and Anthony Green.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer incurs the wrath of the local golf club by declaring their prize trophy is a fake - and almost gets Lady Jane expelled into the bargain. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane, Chris Jury and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lady Jane and Lovejoy grow closer while visiting a Gothic temple in Scotland. Eric falls head over heels in love and Tinker feels all at sea. Drama, with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: The return of an old enemy leads to a series of problems, beginning with the loss of Sharpe's hard-earned captaincy, and culminating in a race against time to rescue his lover Teresa and their baby from the beleaguered city of Badajoz before Wellesley's forces attack. Military adventure, starring Sean Bean and Pete Postlethwaite.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads inadvertently turn up at the wrong Spanish villa and go skinny-dipping in its swimming pool - much to the outrage of the property's occupants, who arrive home unexpectedly. Tim Healy, Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Bill Paterson star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Two relentless tabloid reporters pursue the lads, convinced they are a pack of heavy-duty villains wanted back home for an audacious payroll robbery. Comedy drama, starring Christopher Fairbank and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to cure a patchy lawn at a select language school hiding dark secrets. The disappearance of a Polish student alerts them to a tale of passion, rivalry and revenge, and when a handyman is found with his throat cut they race to find the killer. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary investigate the mysterious death of a blind professor caught up in a bitter battle to save his beloved allotment from an unscrupulous land developer. A heady blend of weedkiller, cannabis and high finance hangs in the air as the duo search for clues - and another body is turned up before they track down the villain. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary and Laura are employed to restore a country churchyard in time for a medieval fair, but it is not long before a local landowner is killed by an arrow beneath an ancient yew in the centre of the graveyard. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Kristin, Breen and Gina witness a fatal skydiving accident while celebrating Mike's birthday with a picnic. To make matters worse, Kristin knows the victim - entrepreneur Andre Barrington, an ex-boyfriend. When the cords are found severed, it becomes clear that his demise was either suicide or murder.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch's distressing childhood memories are evoked while investigating the death of an orphan under the care of the same Jesuit priest who taught him.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The team members set out to prevent a gangster's firearms deal, an act which Alex believes will prevent her being shot in 2008. To obtain evidence, they have to bring the suspect's boyfriend on side, taking him to a gay club where he can see his lover is not the man he thinks he is. Ray is forced to use all his macho charm to seduce the villain in front of witnesses. Drama starring Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene questions an old adversary about a robbery, and when it is revealed the crook has had to give up his life of crime, the detective worries that he too might be past his best. However, an interview with a murder suspect puts Alex in mortal danger - and leaves Gene drawing on his experience in an attempt to save her. Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister defends a British ambassador's daughter accused of murdering an Austrian journalist, and learns a harsh lesson in the realities of political and diplomatic power. Foxcott is singed by an old flame, while Matt risks his father's anger by moving into a squat. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Lena Headey, Michael Feast and Oliver Ford Davies.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Sky News @ Breakfast
programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Team Veredus play in a special mid-season tournament while Ariston and Mangle help Feronia break out of the Corvus Prison.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on one of the UK's toughest obstacle courses, but can he beat the clock and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he is housesitting for Weasel. When he sees him returning from the grocery store with Fizz, he thinks they're burglars!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel are at the supermarket buying ingredients to make the world's best cake. They bump into Magoo, who thinks he's at a carnival!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is lost in a pyramid but he is in fact in a big conference room where Fizz is about to perform a stand-up act..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: It's cold, the boiler is broken, and Mr. Bean has to get warm, fast..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: A trip to the South Pole goes upside down when Team Tennyson lands on the North Pole instead.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The TV chef is joined in the kitchen by singer Paul Young, and whips up a feast with chefs Romy Gill and Paul Rankin. Plus, eco-chef Tom Hunt offers tips on sustainable cooking.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Corsica brings him to the island of Bonifacio, where he learns about its history and culture from tour guide Christine, before whipping up some cheesy stuffed aubergines. He also visits a honey producer, joins a local chef to cook with bovine bread and meets an olive oil-maker, using his some for his fish stew with garlic mayonnaise.

programme.title: Casper (1995)
programme.desc: A paranormal expert moves into a haunted house where his daughter befriends the amiable ghost of a young boy - but things start to go awry when three smelly spooks and two dastardly crooks try to chase the new residents away. Family comedy, starring Christina Ricci, Bill Pullman, Eric Idle, Cathy Moriarty and featuring the voice of Malachi Pearson.

credits.actor: featuring the voice of Malachi Pearson

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family of five spanning three generations answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Huw, Sudeh, Thomas and Nadia pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: The Virtual Grand National
programme.desc: Nick Luck and guests watch as Red Rum takes on Tiger Roll in a special race and they reveal how the 2020 Grand National may have been won.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four celebrity contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Emmerdale's Michael Parr (Ross Barton), England footballer Alex Scott, Hollyoaks actress Jennifer Metcalfe (Mercedes McQueen) and TV presenter Bill Turnbull must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore, star guests and a chance for a member of the audience to win the items advertised in one of last week's commercial breaks. Following the coronavirus outbreak, the planned series finale at Walt Disney World in Florida has been cancelled. However, the Geordie pair will surely have something up their sleeves to put a smile on the faces of the viewing public.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from locations around the UK, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to 1000 in the big finale game. This week, Stephen is in Bristol.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.sub-title: The Voice UK: Most Memorable Moments
programme.desc: Will.i.am introduces some of the highlights of the past four series, recalling some of the performances in the Blind Auditions that got the coaches' chairs in a spin, as well as memorable moments from the Battle and Knockout rounds.

programme.title: Inception (2010)
programme.desc: A talented thief uses hi-tech devices to enter other people's dreams so he can steal their secrets. An industrialist hires him to perform a far more challenging job - to implant an idea into a corporate heir's mind, so he will think it is his own. However, the mission is compromised by the thief's own troubled psyche. Christopher Nolan's sci-fi thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Ellen Page, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Tom Hardy.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Part one of two. A menacing storm moves into the fleet, with a wave ripping steel at the Cape Caution. Freshman skipper Jake finds it difficult to battle through the winds.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: An insight into how a mega fish factory produced three million pounds of seafood a day. Plus, a flying ambulance operating 14,000 feet above Alaska's wilderness.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mechanic Edd China teams up with Mike Brewer to get a classic Saab 900 Turbo back on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China face the challenge of working to a tight budget as they continue with the Saab 900 Turbo restoration.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Volvo P1800 - but owing to a lack of available specimens, has trouble finding one that fits into his price range.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes the Chevy to Sweden, where there is a big market for American cars, and hopes to trade his way up to a Volvo Sports Coupe.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer wants a high-performance car with a historic badge, but it proves difficult to find a Saab 9-3 Turbo at a good price for mechanic Edd China to refurbish.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is challenged to find a classic endurance sports car, and a still-running Volvo PV544 seems to be the perfect example, but the engine proves difficult to master.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead try to arouse the passion of the Saab enthusiast community by restoring a rusty, non-driving 1973 Saab 96 to its past glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Jensen Interceptor, but his 5,000 budget restricts him to poor examples of the car, leaving mechanic Edd China with plenty of work to do.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to Poland to source an FSM Syrena, but with the model being virtually unknown outside of the country, he and Edd China could struggle to make a profit.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: South American Squatch of Argentina: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: A bigfoot-like beast with superhuman strength is reported to live in the foothills of the Andes. Mungo goes on the trail of the Ucumar, believed to be a bear - or even a yeti.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheepyards, the Bushmen are desperate for a breakthrough after a run of bad luck. In White Cliffs, the Young Guns are under financial strain and fall out over their new mine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead claim ownership of a seriously distressed 1965 Dodge A-100 Sportsman, and hopes a custom-built surf inspired makeover will be enough to attract a buyer.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a salvage yard in Cheshire containing vintage gym equipment with real muscle. At an antique shop on the south coast, he spots some decorative religious moulds.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a country estate mentioned in the Domesday Book, unearths a cupboard that has been unopened for decades and finds a weathervane dating to 1800

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life, and Matthew Nickels pieces together a damaged glass picture window.

programme.title: Robson Green's Australian Adventure
programme.desc: The actor journey takes him to Australia's Northern Territory, where he discovers how people thrive within the wilderness, starting at the Top End in the waters of Darwin harbour.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheepyards, the Bushmen are desperate for a breakthrough after a run of bad luck. In White Cliffs, the Young Guns are under financial strain and fall out over their new mine.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: When Patrick Gilhuley was shot dead by his partner Virginia Vertetis in 2014, she claimed it was an act of self-defence. However, her ex-husbands provided evidence of her violent past leading to a 30-year prison sentence being issued.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How the latest scientific and forensic techniques helped solve the case of Robert Andrew, who was shot dead in his Oklahoma City garage in November 2001. It transpired his Sunday school teacher wife Brenda knew more about the attack that she was prepared to reveal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How three seemingly unrelated deaths proved to be the work of one murderer. The killer had been careful by using poison that had no taste or odour. However, investigators realised it would have a unique chemical signature and were able to demonstrate the link.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2016 car salesman Hufracio Arteaga is found stabbed to death in his Michigan City office. Will surveillance cameras from a nearby building reveal the killer? S5/9/16.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: Documentary recalling how in December 2001, Michael Augustson arrived home to a scene of unspeakable horror following the fatal stabbing of his wife Melisa. The pair had only recently moved to Alma, Georgia, where they had soon been accepted by the small-town community.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The work of the FBI's crime laboratory as investigators work to track down the eco-anarchist Unabomber Theodore Kaczynski.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Barbara Christiansen rescues two emaciated dogs, leaving the Houston SPCA team with a fight to save the animals' lives.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney vet Dr Chris Brown attempts to help a lady who runs a shelter for abandoned donkeys. Lisa takes on a six-year-old apprentice who has arrived at Sash with her sick dog, Jelly.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Ivania returns to Kleinfeld Bridal for a reselection, hoping her fiance will agree to the dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'm The Bride, Leave Some Space!
programme.desc: Nikki wants a 'party on a dress' for her New Year's Eve wedding, and there's an unlimited budget. Natalie craves a huge ballgown for her big day.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris is reunited with an old friend, Pluto the singing dalmatian. Plus, cocker spaniel Dusty needs radical ear surgery.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. After a difficult childhood with an abusive stepfather and drug-addicted mother, Sarah weighs over 600lbs and is fighting for her life aged just 24 years old.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. After a difficult childhood with an abusive stepfather and drug-addicted mother, Sarah weighs over 600lbs and is fighting for her life aged just 24 years old.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Marla, who is so heavy she cannot stand up. Bedridden, she must face facts about her health and the toll it takes on her family, who are doing what they can to help.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A 23-year-old man who overeats to cope with memories of his traumatic childhood loses his support network, and must find a new way to regain control of his life.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 45-year-old blues guitarist John Spira who vanished in February 2007, the day he had finalised his divorce. The investigation went cold, until a series of events thrust it back into the limelight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Amy bought a gown elsewhere, before changing her mind, and now she is hunting for her dream dress, while Michelle views her outfit after losing more than three stone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jacqueline goes in search of two dresses of different styles for her wedding, while Christina arrives for her second fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Tara shops with Olympic figure skater and fashionista Johnny Weir, while Taylor brings her fiance Austin to help her find her dream gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: New to wedding dress shopping, Farrah does not seem to know what she wants, while Stephanie's style is vintage glam and she has a clear idea of what to go for.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Natalie is hoping Kleinfeld's will be the last stop on her bridal gown tour, while Amy has lost five stone but still sees herself as overweight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Monisha has come to Kleinfeld's looking for a dress for her three wedding ceremonies, while Mary has a budget of $30,000 to buy two gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pregnant Tisa looks for a dress that makes her feel sexy, while Emily, who is also expecting, tries on her gown for the first time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kristy has lost seven stone and is looking for the right dress to show off her new figure, while Kristin, who has shed almost three stone, is excited to fit into dress samples.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa and Larry's marriage is at breaking points so they begin a trial separation. Plus, Theresa meets Maureen and Danny who wish to connect with their son.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa helps Joe Gatto surprise his sister Carla with a private reading. Later, Theresa meets Jackie who gets the shock of a lifetime.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Doug risks losing two houses that he has filled with clutter if he does not get to grips with his extreme compulsion to collect things in the space of a month.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A young man becomes violently ill and dies soon after eating a fish sandwich, leaving the medic to determine whether it was the result of a rare and lethal form of food poisoning or an unlikely killer. Plus, a woman is killed in a car accident with a drunk driver and the autopsy reveals several devastating clues that she may have played a key role in her own tragic death.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The Gulf War veteran who declared war on the entire LA Police Department in the style of US movie Rambo. With interviews with investigators and family members of victims.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A case in which a teenage couple disappeared from a Colorado neighbourhood in the middle of winter. Their car turned up abandoned and burnt in a field. The spring thaw revealed a hideous truth that shocked the community.
